DFProperties.Description: The root node of the tree. The most important attribute of the root node is its ACL which is by default inherited by all other nodes in the tree, as explained in the standard document DMTND. The root ACL value is customizeable by means of operator-specific customization, but the default string is "Add=*&Get=*&Replace=*&Exec=*".
OMA Standardized Management Object for device information.
The IMEI number of the phone, formatted as a string e.g. "IMEI:123456789012345".
DM Client version. The value could be used, together with the value of the Mod node, to find the correct DDF published on the SonyEricsson website.
Current language for the phone, e.g. "en" for English.
Device manufacturer.
Device model, e.g. "Z600" or "W800i" etc. The value could be used, together with the value of the DmV node, to find the correct DDF published on the SonyEricsson website.
OMA Standardized Management Object for detailed device information (with SonyEricsson-specific extensions under the Ext internal node).
Type of device.
Original Equipment Manufacturer.
Firmware version information.
Software version.
Hardware version. This value is currently not specified and should be ignored.
Indicates whether the device supports the SyncML Large Object Handling specification.
Details about DM-Tree URI formatting.

Specifies the maximum depth of the management tree supported by the device. The maximum depth of the tree is defined as the maximum number of URI segments that the device supports. The value is a 16 bit, unsigned integer encoded as a numerical string. The value "0" means that the device supports a tree of unlimited depth.

Specifies the maximum total length of any URI used to address a node or node property. The maximum total length of a URI is defined as the largest total number of characters making up the URI which the device can support. Note that depending on the character set this might not be the same as the number of bytes. The value is a 16 bit, unsigned integer encoded as a numerical string. The value "0" means that the device supports URI of unlimited length.

Specifies the maximum total length of any URI segment in a URI used to address a node or node property. The maximum total length of a URI segment is defined as the largest number of characters which the device can support in a single URI segment. Note that depending on the used character set this might not be the same as the number of bytes. The value is a 16 bit, unsigned integer encoded as a numerical string. The value "0" means that the device supports URI segments of unlimited length.
SonyEricsson specific DevDetail extensions.
Binay representation of the SonyEricsson crash-data statistics object.
Amount of free space in the filesystem on the device. Does not include space on removeable memory stick.
The IMSI formatted as an ascii-string of hexadecimal octets, e.g. "01 02 03 4A 5B FF".
Detailed firmware version information for e.g. firmware update (FOTA) servers.
The software CXC number.
Software revision.
Filesystem version.
Filesystem.
Network information.
Mobile country code
Current Mobile country code
OMA Standardized Management Object. This node contains DM Accounts (1.1.2).
OMA Standardized Management Object for DM 1.1.2 accounts.
Path to the internet profile placeholder in the DM-tree which holds the internet profile to be used, e.g. "./AP/Proxy/proxy-01".
Container for Access Point settings, i.e. data accounts (NAP) and internet profiles (Proxy).
Internet accounts.
Placeholder for an internet account.
Indicates if the proxy should be used.
The preferred and optional secondary data-account used by this profile to connect to the network.
Path to the data account placeholder in the DM-tree which should be used, e.g. "./AP/NAP_PSD/NapPsd-01".
Path to the data account placeholder in the DM-tree which should be used, e.g. "./AP/NAP_CSD/NapCsd-01".
Optional Proxy authentication information.
Default browser start-page.
Indicates the currently selected active/default profile. It's a path to the internet profile placeholder in the DM-tree, e.g. "./AP/Proxy/proxy-01".
Packet switched data accounts.
Note: The device supports a TOTAL of 10 data accounts, i.e. the sum of PSD and CSD accounts can be up to 10.
The device-assigned account ID. This node is read-only and automatically added by the Client on existing accounts. It can not be added by DM-server for new accounts.
Further editing of an account is prevented when it's been locked, except for unlocking it again by replacing this node with False.
Prompt user for password.
Indicates if data compression should be used.
Indicates if packet header compression should be used.
Circuit switched data accounts.
Note: The device supports a TOTAL of 10 data accounts, i.e. the sum of PSD and CSD accounts can be up to 10.
The device-assigned account ID. This node is read-only and automatically added by the Client on existing accounts. It can not be added by DM-server for new accounts.
Further editing of an account is prevented when it's been locked, except for unlocking it again by replacing this node with False.
Prompt user for password.
Indicates if data compression should be used.
OMA Standardized Management Object for FUMO (Firmware Update over the air Management Object).
Firmware Update package information.
This node specifies the Name associated with the firmware update package.
This node specifies the Version information for the firmware update package.
Contains a value indicating the current state of the mobile device with respect to this firmware update. For a table of the values and their meaning, please refer to the OMA FUMO documentation.
This interior node is the target of an 'Exec' command in order to initiate a firmware download for the specified update package.
This node specifies the URL where the firmware update package or download descriptor is located.
This interior node is a target of an 'Exec' command in order to initiate a firmware update for the specified update package.
This node is the target of a 'Replace' command when DM is used to directly provide the binary firmware update package.
This interior node is the target of an 'Exec' command invoked to initiate a firmware download and an immediate update for the specified update package.
This node specifies the URL where the firmware update package or download descriptor is located, that is to be downloaded and immediately installed.
Container for SonyEricsson proprietary management objects.
Management objects for manageable phone data content.
Container for the embedded browser's content (bookmarks).
Container for bookmark objects.
A placeholder for bookmark-settings. A new bookmark can be added to the browser's list by adding a placeholder and at least the Title and URL leaf nodes.
Folder in which the bookmark is grouped.
Management objects mapping settings for different phone applications.
Generic JAVA settings.
Path to the internet profile placeholder in the DM-tree which holds the internet profile to be used, e.g. "./AP/Proxy/proxy-01".
Settings for media content streaming.
Path to the data account placeholder in the DM-tree which should be used, e.g. "./AP/NAP_PSD/NapPsd-01".
Indicates if the proxy should be used.
Settings for the MMS (picture messages) application.
Request read report.
Request delivery report.
Send delivery report.
Reject advertisment.
Reject anonymous.
Sender visible.
Path to the internet profile placeholder in the DM-tree which holds the internet profile to be used, e.g. "./AP/Proxy/proxy-01".
Settings for the SMS (text message) application.

A comma-separated list of SMS Centers addresses (phone numbers). Typically max 5 numbers (though this depends on the limits of the SIM in use) of max 20 characters each including optional leading "+". Valid characters are "0"-"9", "*" and "#". E.g. "+4640107107,1234,8*4#21". Important note: if more than the maximum numbers are replaced, the DM client will indicate this with a status of 400 - but the first correct numbers will be accepted anyway. Thus a subsequent Get on the node will return the (typically) 5 first numbers of the failed replace.

A comma-separated list of SMS Email Gateway addresses (phone numbers). Typically max 5 numbers (though this depends on the limits of the SIM in use) of max 20 characters each including optional leading "+". Valid characters are "0"-"9", "*" and "#". E.g. "+4640107107,1234,8*4#21". Important note: if more than the maximum numbers are replaced, the DM client will indicate error with a status of 400 - but the first correct numbers will be accepted anyway. Thus a subsequent Get on the node will return the (typically) 5 first numbers of the failed replace.
Allow concatenated messages.
Request Delivery status report.
Request Reply.
Settings for the Email application.
Placeholder representing an email account.
Path to the data account placeholder in the DM-tree which should be used, e.g. "./AP/NAP/Nap-01".

Only one account can be "active" at a time, and this setting indicate whether this is the currently active account. Replacing with "True" will automatically set all other accounts' Active-nodes to FALSE, indicating that the selected account is now "active". Replacing this with "False" has no effect, since one account must always be the active one.
Incoming mail settings.
Outgoing mail settings.
Enable automatic BCC of outgoing mail.
Settings for the "My Friends" application (Wireless Village).
Path to the internet profile placeholder in the DM-tree which holds the internet profile to be used, e.g. "./AP/Proxy/proxy-01".
Indicate if auto-login is enabled.
Allow connection if roaming.
Indicates if the application is enabled. (Read only)

Path to the internet profile placeholder in the DM-tree which holds the internet profile to be used, e.g. "./AP/Proxy/proxy-01".

(Read Only) History log of Firmware Update operations, in readable ASCII plain text.

The Ext-subtree is an area where undefined "dummy" nodes can be added. Primarily for testing purposes, these nodes will be added to the DM tree but not affect the device or its applications in any way (other than consuming space).
Dummy nodes must be placed within a placeholder.
Dummy-nodes can have any name and any format except "node", i.e. it's only possible to have one level of interior placeholders under Ext.
